reason: Two minor expository gaps: (1) The test functions f_j = psi_eps, psi_eps^2, psi_eps^3 depend on eps, so the bound M(alpha, f_j, k_j) from 1.6.2.10.2.4 also depends on eps through f_j. The proof does not explicitly note that M depends on f only through spatial L^p norms, and ||psi_eps^j||_{L^p} <= ||psi^j||_{L^p} by Young's convolution inequality, ensuring uniformity in eps. (2) The fourth term <(-Delta+m^2)psi, phi> pairs with the unregularized field phi, not with :phi_eps^1: = phi_eps. Node 1.6.2.10.2.4 bounds E_{mu_eps}[exp(alpha <f, phi_eps>)], not E_{mu_eps}[exp(alpha <f, phi>)]. The same BG partition function method gives the required bound for linear functionals of phi, but the proof does not distinguish these cases. Neither gap affects the validity of the conclusion.
